meanings.definition: Unwilling to compromise or change one's opinions or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She was intransigeantly stubborn about her decision.
meanings.sent2: He always behaves intransigeantly when it comes to following rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat was intransigeantly refusing to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood intransigeantly against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: His intransigeantly rigid beliefs never wavered.

meanings.definition: In a manner that shows refusal to compromise or change.
meanings.sent1: She spoke intransigeantly, refusing to consider any other options.
meanings.sent2: He insisted intransigeantly on sticking to the original plan.
meanings.sent3: The child stomped intransigeantly when asked to share his toys.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged intransigeantly, not giving any respite.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked intransigeantly, marking the passing time.
